page.title: 13PATCHWAY SORTING OFFICE
page.content: This was built in 1975. Before that mail was sorted in a shed behind the small Post Office. About 20,000 letters and 450 parcels are sorted daily. There are 3 delivery areas:- Patchway,Filton and Almondsbury. In a month,postmen cover 3,539 miles in vans,bikes and on foot.The sorting office opens at 5.20am and closes at 1.00p.m. The first van brings letters at 5.20a.m.,the second van brings letters and parcels at 6.00a.m. Weekday deliveries start at 7.00 and finish at 12.00noon. On Saturday they finish at 10.00a.m. There are 20 postmen and 17women, 5 vans and 28 bikes. Patchway has 17 post boxes,Almondsbury 15 and Filton 10. There is no weight limit on parcels which can be a problem as once a special van had to come from Bristol.
